Just found this, looks like this wasn’t solvable back then either
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YH119N2/p1664385192477539>

If we’d want to limit a CMS editor to only insert fixed sections, is there a way to remove module drag and drop content-field on the right side of the editor, but still have the blue + for sections available?

In our tests it seems that a dnd_area (including the “Drop modules here” box) is mandatory for sections to be inserted.

Anyone got an idea?
You could set every module as "is_available_for_new_content": false so they won't be available, but users will still have access to default modules
In out tests it seems that a dnd_area (including the “Drop modules here” box) is mandatory for sections to be inserted.

Yeha thought so… crud.

This is the box i want to remove from the page view
I think its not a a good User Experience to limit the abilities of the Users that much
As in i don’t want a content editor to drop modules left and right, only prefixed sections
It is a wonderful experience as the sections will contain everything they need and also secure that the design is not being trashed over time
:slightly_smiling_face:
wonderful?
Yeah our clients like that they won’t break anything and secure the layout is always as intended
It’s a bit more detailed than that but would require quite some explaining on my part.
Bottom line: restriction can be both good and bad
I get that, but HubSpot has clearly taking a different path with the editor, so you will have to keep fighting against the intent of the editor
I dont mind some brawling :smile:
We already have to fight the system to get optimal performance, so… nothing new  :wink:
What about creating modules that in fact are just sections? (and use macros for reusable components) a lot of themes in the marketplace work like that

Yeah we’ve done that before, but find that just adding a section using the blue + is much easier for the content editor as they’ll sometimes - by accident - drop those modules into the section occupied by the previous module (vertically).
And other kinds of shenanigans

I mean, obviously we can just instruct the client to not touch the modules on the left hand side and that’ll work in most cases too.

It was merely out of interest whether or not it was doable to limit the editor to only inserting prebuilt sections
I know the pain

In my opinion, Restricting the user is not the right answer, showing what is possible, education the user on the capabilities and what to watch out for / keep in mind, is the way better strategy. Its like keeping kids on training wheels all the time  :smile:
